lead_paragraph: Majd Oweida, 22, was arrested on his way out of Gaza. He said he was seeking contestants for a show, but he was charged with hacking airport computers.

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Majd Al Waheidi from Gaza.
byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

headline.print_headline: Family Sees a TV Talent Scout Where the Israeli Authorities See a Jihadist Spy
headline.main: Family Sees TV Talent Scout Where Israeli Authorities See Jihadist Spy

snippet: Majd Oweida, 22, was arrested on his way out of Gaza. He said he was seeking contestants for a show, but he was charged with hacking airport computers.
abstract: Israeli authorities charge Majd Oweida for hacking into computers at Israel's international airport, claiming he was spying for Iranian-backed extremist group Palestinian Islamic Jihad; Oweida's family deny involvement, saying he was leaving Gaza to find potential contestants for planned Palestinians Got Talent television show.
